name: instinctually
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that happens naturally, rather than being thought about, planned, or developed by training: Most people instinctually understand the difference between right and wrong. I had no time to form a plan but just reacted instinctually.
More examplesFewer examplesWe instinctually aspire to accumulate wealth and material possessions.The fish instinctually swim up the river to find a suitable place to lay their eggs.We are instinctually programmed to work for the good of our family, our tribe, or our nation.
